verses.kjv: Then came the daughters of Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of Manasseh the son of Joseph: and these are the names of his daughters; Mahlah, Noah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.ct: The daughters of Zelophehad came forward. Zelophehad was the son of Hepher, son of Gilead, son of Machir, son of Manasseh, from the clan of Manasseh son of Joseph. His daughters' names were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

verses.kjv: And they stood before Moses, and before Eleazar the priest, and before the princes and all the congregation, by the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, saying,
verses.ct: They stood in front of Moses, Eleazar the priest, the leaders, and the entire community at the entrance of the tent of meeting and said,

verses.kjv: Our father died in the wilderness, and he was not in the company of them that gathered themselves together against the LORD in the company of Korah; but died in his own sin, and had no sons.
verses.ct: "Our father died in the wilderness. He was not part of the group that rebelled against the LORD with Korah's followers — he died because of his own sin. And he had no sons.

verses.kjv: Why should the name of our father be done away from among his family, because he hath no son? Give unto us therefore a possession among the brethren of our father.
verses.ct: Why should our father's name disappear from his family just because he had no son? Give us property among our father's brothers."

verses.kjv: And Moses brought their cause before the LORD.
verses.ct: Moses brought their case to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.kjv: The daughters of Zelophehad speak right: thou shalt surely give them a possession of an inheritance among their father’s brethren; and thou shalt cause the inheritance of their father to pass unto them.
verses.ct: "The daughters of Zelophehad are right. You must give them property as an inheritance among their father's brothers, and transfer their father's inheritance to them.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying, If a man die, and have no son, then ye shall cause his inheritance to pass unto his daughter.
verses.ct: Tell the people of Israel: If a man dies without having a son, you must transfer his inheritance to his daughter.

verses.kjv: And if he have no daughter, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his brethren.
verses.ct: If he has no daughter, then give his inheritance to his brothers.

verses.kjv: And if he have no brethren, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his father’s brethren.
verses.ct: If he has no brothers, then give his inheritance to his father's brothers.

verses.kjv: And if his father have no brethren, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his kinsman that is next to him of his family, and he shall possess it: and it shall be unto the children of Israel a statute of judgment, as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: If his father has no brothers, then give his inheritance to his closest relative in his family, and that person will take possession of it. This will serve as a legal rule for the people of Israel, just as the LORD commanded Moses."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Get thee up into this mount Abarim, and see the land which I have given unto the children of Israel.
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Moses, "Go up this mountain in the Abarim range and look out over the land that I have given to the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: And when thou hast seen it, thou also shalt be gathered unto thy people, as Aaron thy brother was gathered.
verses.ct: After you have seen it, you too will die and join your ancestors, just as your brother Aaron did.

verses.kjv: For ye rebelled against my commandment in the desert of Zin, in the strife of the congregation, to sanctify me at the water before their eyes: that is the water of Meribah in Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.
verses.ct: This is because both of you defied my command in the wilderness of Zin when the community argued with me. You failed to honor me as holy in front of them at the water." This refers to the waters of Meribah at Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.

verses.kjv: And Moses spake unto the LORD, saying,
verses.ct: Moses spoke to the LORD and said,

verses.kjv: Let the LORD, the God of the spirits of all flesh, set a man over the congregation,
verses.ct: "May the LORD, the God who gives breath to every living being, appoint someone to lead the community —

verses.kjv: Which may go out before them, and which may go in before them, and which may lead them out, and which may bring them in; that the congregation of the LORD be not as sheep which have no shepherd.
verses.ct: someone who will lead them out and bring them back, who will guide them in everything they do, so that the LORD's community won't be like sheep without a shepherd."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Take thee Joshua the son of Nun, a man in whom is the spirit, and lay thine hand upon him;
verses.ct: The LORD replied to Moses, "Take Joshua son of Nun, a man who has the spirit in him, and place your hand on him.

verses.kjv: And set him before Eleazar the priest, and before all the congregation; and give him a charge in their sight.
verses.ct: Present him to Eleazar the priest and the entire community, and commission him in front of everyone.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt put some of thine honour upon him, that all the congregation of the children of Israel may be obedient.
verses.ct: Transfer some of your authority to him so that the whole community of Israel will follow his leadership.

verses.kjv: And he shall stand before Eleazar the priest, who shall ask counsel for him after the judgment of Urim before the LORD: at his word shall they go out, and at his word they shall come in, both he, and all the children of Israel with him, even all the congregation.
verses.ct: He will stand before Eleazar the priest, who will seek guidance for him through the Urim before the LORD. At Eleazar's direction, they will go out, and at his direction they will come back — both Joshua and all the people of Israel with him, the entire community."

verses.kjv: And Moses did as the LORD commanded him: and he took Joshua, and set him before Eleazar the priest, and before all the congregation:
verses.ct: Moses did what the LORD commanded him. He took Joshua and presented him to Eleazar the priest and the whole community.

verses.kjv: And he laid his hands upon him, and gave him a charge, as the LORD commanded by the hand of Moses.
verses.ct: He placed his hands on him and commissioned him, just as the LORD had instructed through Moses.
